formattedAddress: 225 Cherry St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 225 Cherry St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text:
One Manhattan Square is a luxurious residential skyscraper located in the Two Bridges neighborhood of Lower Manhattan, New York City. Developed by Extell Development Company, the 847-foot (258 m) tall tower stands out prominently in the Manhattan skyline, offering breathtaking views of the city and the East River.

Design and Amenities

Designed by Adamson Associates Architects, One Manhattan Square features a sleek, glass-and-steel facade that reflects the dynamic energy of New York City. The building's interior is equally impressive, boasting a collection of world-class amenities and finishes. Residents enjoy access to a sprawling 100,000-square-foot amenity deck, including:

A private park with lush landscaping and a meandering jogging path
A 75-foot indoor saltwater swimming pool with stunning river views
A state-of-the-art fitness center with a yoga studio and a rock climbing wall
A private screening room for exclusive movie nights
A children's playroom with interactive games and activities
A tranquil residents' lounge with fireplaces and catering kitchens
A business center with private meeting rooms and Wi-Fi access
Residences

One Manhattan Square offers a variety of luxurious residences, ranging from one-bedroom to five-bedroom apartments. Each residence is meticulously designed with high-end finishes, including:

Floor-to-ceiling windows that showcase panoramic city and river views
Custom-designed kitchens with top-of-the-line appliances
Spacious living areas with hardwood floors and ample storage
Luxurious bathrooms with marble countertops and soaking tubs
Location

One Manhattan Square is situated in the vibrant Two Bridges neighborhood, known for its trendy restaurants, art galleries, and boutique shops. The neighborhood is also home to several parks and green spaces, offering residents a tranquil escape amidst the urban buzz. Convenient transportation options include the East Broadway subway station and the FDR Drive.

Overall, One Manhattan Square is an exceptional residential destination, offering luxury, convenience, and breathtaking views of New York City

originalText.text: I don’t live here but I did get a mailer encouraging me to buy an apartment in this building. Quite clearly there is a lot of empty units they are struggling to fill because of horrible location and unreasonable pricing for an artificially luxurious building. Maybe instead of wasting time, materials, and postage, you could stop contributing to the lack of affordable housing in the city. I’d like to be taken off your mailing list.

Maybe instead of wasting time, materials, and postage, you could stop contributing to the lack of affordable housing in the city. I’d like to be taken off your mailing list.

originalText.text: My husband and I have lived here for over a year and we love the building. Amazing amenities. We’ve never had to wait for any gym equipment. Pool and spa are gorgeous. We love the neighborhood and the amazing restaurants and shopping in the area.

text.text: My husband and I have lived here for over a year and we love the building. Amazing amenities. We’ve never had to wait for any gym equipment. Pool and spa are gorgeous. We love the neighborhood and the amazing restaurants and shopping in the area.

originalText.text: DO NOT LIVE HERE if you care at all about fitness! While the website makes you believe it is an amenity-rich building, this is far from the case. The weight room only has 7 machines. There are 72 floors and 811 units in the building. There are over 1,200 residents. That is one machine for every 152 residents. This tiny "gym" gets extremely crowded, with people literally waiting in line to work out on their very tiny amount of equipment. They have four other empty "dance rooms" which I have never seen a single person use. The problem is further exacerbated by the fact that due to its very strange location in the middle of the LES projects, there are literally no other gyms within walking distance. If you work out, your ONLY option is the building gym. Also, you may have noticed pictures of a pool on the website. Well they close the pool all day. It is only open in the morning and evening, when it fills up. I highly recommend you find somewhere else to live. 0/10

originalText.text: Needless to say that the building speaks for itself.
